channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: DOT proposes ban on airline fees for seating families together
item.description: The Biden administration has sought to eliminate airline "junk fees," which are unexpected and obscured additional costs on travel tickets.
item.content:encoded:
The Biden administration has sought to eliminate airline "junk fees," which are unexpected and obscured additional costs on travel tickets.

(Image credit: Michael Dwyer)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Trump lies about Harris’ race. And, Olympic rugby player takes over TikTok
item.description: Former President Donald Trump questioned Vice President Kamala Harris' biracial identity on stage at the NABJ conference. And, U.S. rugby player Ilona Maher becomes a standout at the Olympic Games.
item.content:encoded:
Former President Donald Trump questioned Vice President Kamala Harris' biracial identity on stage at the NABJ conference. And, U.S. rugby player Ilona Maher becomes a standout at the Olympic Games.

(Image credit: Scott Olson/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Wildfire season is very busy in the West. Long-term trend paints a worse picture
item.description: There are roughly 100 large wildfires burning in the western U.S., including one of the largest in California history. Why so many? Scientists point to climate change and firefighting policies.
item.content:encoded: There are roughly 100 large wildfires burning in the western U.S., including one of the largest in California history. Why so many? Scientists point to climate change and firefighting policies.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Rott

item.title: 2 assassinations in the last 48 hours may destabilize the entire Middle East
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Lebanese Foreign Minister Bou Habib about whether his country is bracing for a wider war with Israel.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Lebanese Foreign Minister Bou Habib about whether his country is bracing for a wider war with Israel.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Israel confirms it killed Hamas military commander in a July airstrike
item.description: Israel's military says the commander of Hamas is dead. The announcement comes following a series of assassinations of top Hamas and Hezbollah leaders in the region.
item.content:encoded:
Israel's military says the commander of Hamas is dead. The announcement comes following a series of assassinations of top Hamas and Hezbollah leaders in the region.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Harris tries out a new role: consoler-in-chief
item.description: America's consoler-in-chief has always been a man. Today, Vice President Harris shows her approach to this uniquely difficult part of the job.
item.content:encoded:
America's consoler-in-chief has always been a man. Today, Vice President Harris shows her approach to this uniquely difficult part of the job.

(Image credit: Geoff Robins)
item.dc:creator: Tamara Keith

item.title: Report: Ukraine receives first batch of U.S.-made F-16 fighter jets
item.description: Ukraine has long sought the U.S.-made warplanes, saying they're needed to counter Russia's superior air power. Four NATO members have pledged F-16s, though it wasn't clear who sent them, or how many.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine has long sought the U.S.-made warplanes, saying they're needed to counter Russia's superior air power. Four NATO members have pledged F-16s, though it wasn't clear who sent them, or how many.

(Image credit: Burhan Ozbilici)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Assassinations in the Middle East stoke fears of more violence. The case against three of the alleged 9/11 attack plotters reaches a conclusion. More than 100 large wildfires are burning in the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Assassinations in the Middle East stoke fears of more violence. The case against three of the alleged 9/11 attack plotters reaches a conclusion. More than 100 large wildfires are burning in the U.S.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: I’ve been obsessed with rugby for 30 years, and I’m so here for this Olympic moment
item.description: The U.S. women’s rugby team just won a historic Olympic medal for the country. To this longtime player and fan, it’s a pivotal moment for the sport and a reminder of how it changed her life.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. women’s rugby team just won a historic Olympic medal for the country. To this longtime player and fan, it’s a pivotal moment for the sport and a reminder of how it changed her life.

(Image credit: Carl De Souza)
item.dc:creator: Amy Morgan

item.title: Amazon must recall unsafe products sold by independent sellers, a consumer agency says
item.description: The decision stems from a suit by the Consumer Product Safety Commission over products sold on Amazon that the agency found to be unsafe, including children's sleepwear and carbon monoxide detectors.
item.content:encoded:
The decision stems from a suit by the Consumer Product Safety Commission over products sold on Amazon that the agency found to be unsafe, including children's sleepwear and carbon monoxide detectors.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez
